Class Viewport

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Viewport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimulationScreen.Zoom

    public class Viewport
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.io.Serializable, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
    A JPanel that manages the navigation and drawing of a Spacetime object.
    Author:
    Sally Hui, Jiayin Huang, Tony Cui
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Constant Field Values

      • minZoom

        public static final double minZoom
        The minimum zoom value. Default is 1/√2.

      • maxZoom

        public static final double maxZoom
        The maximum zoom value. Default is 16.

      • focus

        private Entity focus
        The Viewport will follow this specified Entity around, if it is not null.

      • mouse

        protected java.awt.Point mouse
        The current location of the mouse, relative to the JPanel. In pixels.

      • click

        protected java.awt.Point click
        The location of the last mouse click, relative to the JPanel. In pixels.

      • offset

        public java.awt.Point offset
        The number of pixels to translate the Spacetime object, x-wise and y-wise.

      • zoom

        public double zoom
        Current zoom value; lengths and widths are all scaled by this value.

      • grid

        public Spacetime grid
        The Spacetime object that this Viewport looks into.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Viewport

        public Viewport(Spacetime grid)
        Creates a new Viewport looking into the specified Spacetime object. Automatically adds the MouseListeners necessary for navigation.
        Parameters:
        grid - the Spacetime to look into

    • Method Detail

      • addMouseListeners

        public void addMouseListeners()
        Adds a MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, and MouseWheelListener, all of which are necessary for moving and zooming.

      • advanceVP

        public void advanceVP()
        Manually advances the simulation.

      • setMoveEntity

        public void setMoveEntity(boolean start)
        Starts or stops the mode to move entities.
        Parameters:
        start - to start or stop moving entities

      • centerAt

        public void centerAt(java.awt.geom.Point2D gridCoords)
        Centers this Viewport at the specified Spacetime coordinates.
        Parameters:
        gridCoords - the Spacetime coordinates to center at

      • convertPointGridToMouse

        public java.awt.Point convertPointGridToMouse(java.awt.Point gridCoords)
        Converts Spacetime coordinates into JPanel coordinates.
        Parameters:
        gridCoords - the Spacetime coordinates to be converted
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the point on this Viewport that is directly above the specified grid coordinates

      • convertPointMouseToGrid

        public java.awt.Point convertPointMouseToGrid(java.awt.Point p)
        Converts JPanel coordinates into Spacetime coordinates.
        Parameters:
        p - the mouse coordinates
        Returns:
        the Spacetime grid coordinates of the point that is directly underneath the specified Viewport coordinates

      • deselect

        public void deselect()
        Clears the list of selected Entities.

      • followEntity

        public void followEntity(Entity e)
        Sets the Viewport to follow around the specified Entity until it is removed from the Spacetime that this Viewport is monitoring.
        Parameters:
        e - the Entity to follow

      • removeMouseListeners

        public void removeMouseListeners()

      • setZoom

        public void setZoom(double newZoom,
           java.awt.Point zoomCenter)
        Sets the zoom to the specified value. Centers the zooming action at the specified point, which is in JPanel coordinates.
        Parameters:
        newZoom - the new zoom value
        zoomCenter - the anchor point of this zoom

      • updateMove

        private void updateMove(java.awt.Point now)
        Called by the MouseListener. Shifts the Viewport offset by the amount that the mouse moved since this method was last called. This method uses the click variable to store the previous location of the mouse.
        Parameters:
        now - the current location of the mouse

      • updateZoom

        private void updateZoom(int wheelRotation)
        Called by the MouseWheelListener. Updates the zoom. Adjusts the Viewport offset so that the point underneath the mouse remains centered.
        Parameters:
        wheelRotation - the mouse wheel increment
